com.github.dkharrat.nexusdata.core

Class FetchRequest<T extends ManagedObject>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dkharrat.nexusdata.core.FetchRequest<T>

  • public class FetchRequest<T extends ManagedObject>
extends Object
    Describes query to the persistence store to retrieve all the objects that match the specified criteria. A FetchRequest is passed to an ObjectContext to handle the query. Each FetchRequest is tied to a specific Entity type, meaning that only objects of the specified entity type are returned.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  FetchRequest.Builder<T extends ManagedObject>
      A builder class that simplifies the creation of a FetchRequest.

        public FetchRequest(Entity<T> entity)

        Parameters:

      • hasSortDescriptors

        public boolean hasSortDescriptors()
        Returns true if this fetch request specifies any sort descriptors.
        Returns:
        true if this fetch request specifies any sort descriptors, or false otherwise.

      • setSortDescriptors

        public void setSortDescriptors(List<SortDescriptor> sortDescriptors)
        Sets the list of sort descriptors to use for this fetch request. This method removes any existing sort descriptors, if any, prior to setting the sort descriptors. A SortDescriptor specifies the type of sorting to perform on the results returned when this fetch request is executed by the persistence store. The order of the SortDescriptor in the list specifies the precedence to use when sorting. For example, if sortDescriptors = List(SortDescriptor("name", true), SortDescriptor("age", false)), then the results are first sorted by name in ascending order, and then for duplicate names, they are sorted by age in descending order.
        Parameters:
        sortDescriptors - the list of sort descriptors to use

      • setSortDescriptor

        public void setSortDescriptor(SortDescriptor sortDescriptor)
        Sets the sort descriptor to use for this fetch request. This method removes any existing sort descriptors, if any prior to setting the sort descriptor.
        Parameters:
        sortDescriptor - the sort descriptor to use

      • addSortDescriptor

        public void addSortDescriptor(SortDescriptor sortDescriptor)
        Adds a sort descriptor to the existing sort descriptors, if any. The list of sort descriptors in a fetch request maintain their order of insertion.
        Parameters:
        sortDescriptor - the sort descriptor to add

      • includesPendingChanges

        public boolean includesPendingChanges()
        Indicates whether this fetch request will cover objects that have pending changes in the ObjectContext but haven't been persisted yet. Default is true.
        Returns:
        true if pending changes will be covered by the query, or false otherwise

      • setIncludePendingChanges

        public void setIncludePendingChanges(boolean includePendingChanges)
        Sets whether this fetch request will cover objects that have pending changes in the ObjectContext but haven't been persisted yet.
        Parameters:
        includePendingChanges - if true, pending changes will be covered by the query. Otherwise, the query will only cover the objects as reflected by the persistence store.

      • returnsObjectsAsFaults

        public boolean returnsObjectsAsFaults()
        Indicates whether the objects returned from the fetch request will be returned as faults. Default is true.
        Returns:
        true if objects will be returned as faults, or false otherwise.

      • setReturnObjectsAsFaults

        public void setReturnObjectsAsFaults(boolean returnObjectsAsFaults)
        Sets whether the objects returned from the fetch request will be returned as faults.
        Parameters:
        returnObjectsAsFaults - if true, objects will be returned as faults. Otherwise, they will be returned fully materialized with their property values initialized. See ObjectContext for a discussion about faulting.
